Initial tests ruled out herpes simplex virus and varicella zoster virus, but PCR tests confirmed the presence of nonvariola orthopoxvirus, specifically vaccinia virus, in the childâ€™s lesions. This was in line with the clinical history of potential exposure, leading to the diagnosis of eczema vaccinatum.
